journal-title-group.journal-title: African Review of Money Finance and Banking

title-group.article-title: LIBERALIZATION, CONSOLIDATION AND MARKET STRUCTURE IN NIGERIAN BANKING

abstract.p: This study analyses the dynamics of market structure in the Nigerian banking system during the period 1997 to 2001. While there was a significant process of structural reforms and bank consolidation that resulted in a decline in the number of banks, market structure measured by the standard indices of concentration did not however change. Moreover, econometric results based on the conjectural variation model indicate a fairly competitive pattern of behavior within this period.
